name: xmlserializer
tagline: xmlserializer serializes a DOM subtree or DOM document into XML/XHTML
body: It understands documents generated by [parse5](https://github.com/inikulin/parse5) and regular browser DOMs (and thus can act as a drop-in replacement for [XMLSerializer](https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/XMLSerializer) which for some browsers only serializes true XML documents).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
